greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Partial sums of (-1)^floor(n*2^(1/3)).
comment: Remarkably, these partial sums appear to have several periods of length 153008. This sum is not discussed by O'Bryant et al.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..40000
Kevin O'Bryant, Bruce Reznick and Monika Serbinowska, Almost alternating sums, arXiv:math/0308087 [math.NT], 2003-2005.
Kevin O'Bryant, Bruce Reznick and Monika Serbinowska, Almost alternating sums, Amer. Math. Monthly, Vol. 113 (October 2006), 673-688.
xref: Cf. A123737 (sum for sqrt(2)), A123738 (sum for Pi), A123739 (sum for e).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Oct 11 2006
